alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 29 at 8:54PM PST until December 03 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW... .Several rounds of precipitation will move through the Inland NW starting in the Cascades by early Thursday afternoon and persist into the weekend. The Cascade crest and Idaho Panhandle will get hit with heavy snow accumulations. The first widespread valley snow is forecast as well with light to moderate accumulations. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 feet along the Cascade crest with the highest amounts around Stevens Pass. Snow amounts of 2 to 6 inches in the Methow Valley. * WHERE...Winthrop, Methow, Holden Village, Mazama, Conconully, Stevens Pass, Loup Loup Pass, Stehekin, and Twisp. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Be prepared for winter driving conditions, especially over Stevens Pass. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest snow intensity is expected Friday Night into Saturday morning. Another burst of snow is possible for Washington Pass and the Methow Valley on Sunday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County
